602147705.name: La exposici\u00f3n de Javier Mar\u00edn excepcional
602147705.author: a TripAdvisor user
602147705.reviewBody: El museo en su arquitectura es impresionante, me gusta por la fusi\u00f3n de los elementos, y la exposici\u00f3n es maravillosa

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

600912121.name: Exposiciones escogidas y muy bien planeadas
600912121.author: a TripAdvisor user
600912121.reviewBody: Muy grato ver obras de primer nivel, en un espacio amplio, con todos los servicios y gratuito, visite la muestra claroscuro, de Javier Mar\u00edn

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

485111628.name: Buena opcion cultural en Aguascalientes !!
485111628.author: a TripAdvisor user
485111628.reviewBody: Este nuevo museo esta enfocado a presentaciones, exposiciones y galerias. Me da gusto que lo abrieran ya que esta mas enfocado a las artes y los museos del centro es 100 a las tradiciones del estado.\nHay presentaciones de ballet, danza, etc. Su estructura quedo muy original y se encuentra sobre la Avenida Gomez Morin cerca del centro de artes y el salon de locomotoras.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

473192498.name: Concepto integrador
473192498.author: a TripAdvisor user
473192498.reviewBody: El museo espacio se encuentra en lo que eran las instalaciones de los talleres de Ferrocarriles Nacionales de M\u00e9xico, en el se han integrado a las naves industriales diferentes conceptos que van desde cursos a nivel taller o Licenciaturas en Danza Cl\u00e1sica,Contempor\u00e1nea o Folcl\u00f3rica, Teatro o M\u00fasica. Adicionalmente cuenta espacio para exposiciones temporales (generalmente arte contempor\u00e1neo) y diversas actividades culturales, as\u00ed como el Taller Nacional de Gr\u00e1fica. vale la pena dedicar una ma\u00f1ana o tarde para recorrerlo.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

459740137.name: interesante
459740137.author: a TripAdvisor user
459740137.reviewBody: Es un museo moderno, con arquitectura muy estilizada,aunque nada espectacular, resulta interesante las exposiciones que realizan, en general agradable

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

427600204.name: Paseo Cultural
427600204.author: a TripAdvisor user
427600204.reviewBody: Este museo es bastante particular, en el sentido de que fue dise\u00f1ado para exhibir instalaciones y piezas muy grandes, por lo que se puede ver cosas muy diferentes a lo que se ve en otros museos especialmente en Aguascalientes. Fuera de las exhibiciones el museo es muy bonito y se conecta con los complejos de la universidad de las artes y el centro de convenciones de las tres centurias; todas \u00e1reas muy bonitas para caminar y disfrutar de una atmosfera \u00fanica creada por lo que antes fueran las instalaciones de los talleres de locomotoras.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Gomez Morin s/n, Antiguos Talleres de FFCC Barrio de la estacion

669037178.name: Esperaba m\u00e1s
669037178.author: a TripAdvisor user
669037178.reviewBody: Hab\u00eda le\u00eddo varias cr\u00edticas acerca de este lugar y de todas las opciones en vi\u00f1edos en la zona parec\u00eda la mejor, tristemente qued\u00e9 algo decepcionada por el Tour.  El costo es de $300 pesos por persona, el personal aunque amable no tiene los conocimientos suficientes acerca de sus mismos productos, vendimias, ni de la propia marca. El lugar esta un poco escondido, los Tours son por cita y adem\u00e1s te hacen esperar, en nuestro caso m\u00e1s de media hora. La degustaci\u00f3n s\u00f3lo incluye 2 vinos, regulares, ni siquiera sus mejores opciones. A diferencia de otros vi\u00f1edos que te obsequian la Copa, aqu\u00ed nada ni siquiera agua para la degustaci\u00f3n ni mucho menos, algo que esperarias por el precio. Le solicitamos al gu\u00eda la opci\u00f3n de probar Tb3 para poder hacer la compra del mismo y no. Aun asi decidimos adquirirlos, ojala no nos decepcione tambi\u00e9n. Nada accesibles en ese aspecto. No volver\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

668448377.name: Excelente visita
668448377.author: a TripAdvisor user
668448377.reviewBody: Fue una nueva experiencia y me encant\u00f3. El vino que producen es delicioso y el aprendizaje m\u00e1s, pues despejaron todas nuestras dudas. Adem\u00e1s, el gu\u00eda excelente persona. Muy recomendable

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

667911961.name: Tour en el vi\u00f1edo
667911961.author: a TripAdvisor user
667911961.reviewBody: Qued\u00e9 fascinado tanto por el servicio como por los vinos.\nSi quieres ir en familia,con tu pareja o solo la vas a pasar super bien.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

667862585.name: Muy buen vino
667862585.author: a TripAdvisor user
667862585.reviewBody: Muy recomendable su Nebbiolo Tb3. Lastima no lo llevaron a la feria del vino 5ta.  Asist\u00ed con amigos Brasile\u00f1os y no lo pudieron degustar y su personal creo con poco conocimiento del tema y no tan buena actitud. Ojal\u00e1 lo tomen encuenta para pr\u00f3ximos eventos llevar personal m\u00e1s calificado y con mejor presencia.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

619847166.name: Encantadora experiencia
619847166.author: a TripAdvisor user
619847166.reviewBody: Disfrut\u00e9 de un paseo por la Vin\u00edcola acompa\u00f1ada de mis amigos, un d\u00eda inolvidable y lindo, Fernando nos explic\u00f3 perfectamente bien todas nuestras dudas, ademas fuimos en una excelente \u00e9poca del a\u00f1o, nos toc\u00f3 un vi\u00f1edo verde y lleno de vida previo a sus fiestas de la Vendimia.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

619186375.name: Una hermosa experiencia
619186375.author: a TripAdvisor user
619186375.reviewBody: Empezando por el trato siempre amable, la experiencia de Vin\u00edcola Santa Elena ha sido inolvidable. Mi parte favorita ha sido el paseo por los campos de vid y conocer el proceso de elaboraci\u00f3n de sus vinos. No hay duda que en Aguascalientes se dan de los mejores vinos de la rep\u00fablica mexicana!

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

618646800.name: Un paseo inolvidable
618646800.author: a TripAdvisor user
618646800.reviewBody: Desde la llegada, el recibimiento fue c\u00e1lido y amable. Me encant\u00f3 recorrer los campos de vides y conocer la alta tecnolog\u00eda que utilizan para obtener las mejores uvas. Probamos un Entrel\u00edneas y un Sophie, que \u00a1nos encantaron!

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

618637797.name: Aguascalientes produce buenos vinos
618637797.author: a TripAdvisor user
618637797.reviewBody: Un vi\u00f1edo encantador. Desde la reservaci\u00f3n, Fernando fue siempre amable y en el paseo nos expres\u00f3 su pasi\u00f3n por lo que hace al contarnos el origen del vi\u00f1edo, mostrarnos las vides y explicarnos la tecnolog\u00eda que utilizan. Las instalaciones impecables y la cava encantadora. Degustamos dos exquisitos vinos: un Entrel\u00edneas y un Sophie, ampliamente recomendables. Invitados a visitarlos para la vendimia.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

618417882.name: Experiencia vin\u00edcola de calidad!!
618417882.author: a TripAdvisor user
618417882.reviewBody: La mejor tecnolog\u00eda y cuidado de la vid podr\u00e1s encontrar en este vi\u00f1edo que mezcla la tradici\u00f3n vinicola del estado y la modernidad. Vinos de excelente calidad. Pasar\u00e1s una agradable experiencia en pareja, amigos o familia. S\u00f3lo recuerden hacer previa cita.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

618327293.name: Una experiencia inolvidable
618327293.author: a TripAdvisor user
618327293.reviewBody: Conocer el proceso del vino desde cero me encant\u00f3. El vi\u00f1edo y la Vin\u00edcola no tienen desperdicio... y los vinos!!!!! Definitivamente una experiencia que volver\u00eda a repetir. Muchas gracias por todas sus atenciones.

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

616469445.name: La pasamos bien!
616469445.author: a TripAdvisor user
616469445.reviewBody: Es una Vinicola con tecnolog\u00eda y grandes instalaciones para hacer buenos vinos, es necesario reservar un d\u00eda antes (al menos).

address.streetAddress: Ags18 Valladolid - Emiliano Zapata

667067716.name: Great place to chill...
667067716.author: a TripAdvisor user
667067716.reviewBody:
I go here 2 times a week when I am in the center of the city... It's so relaxing and of course there is great shade too!
Now there is free WiFi too! Absolutely perfect to sit and relax...
Read a book watch the World go by!
Go OXXO get a coffee or water then sit here and relax!
also you can go around to the other side too, there is another area there with water and also some large sculptures to admire..
Perfect place to relax...

489501287.name: Every city needs one of these
489501287.author: a TripAdvisor user
489501287.reviewBody: This patio is simply awesome. It\'s a great place to hang out, and it\'s beautifully lighted at night. Fountains, trees, and an interesting structure. Why don\'t more American cities have some great public spaces?

668094727.name: Superb, small but worth a look :-)
668094727.author: a TripAdvisor user
668094727.reviewBody:
Is small and easy to miss, but when you find it WOW!
It;s behind Plaza Patria - please go take a look!
I walked past and went in for a look around, amazing inside! Really so well decorated and just amazing to see.
Go spend some time inside to appreciate :-)

address.streetAddress: Calle Galeana Norte 104

554685886.name: beautiful temple!
554685886.author: a TripAdvisor user
554685886.reviewBody: Beautiful!!!!! The stained glass is gorgeous. You can get a nice view of them as well next door at the restaurant... but just look don\'t eat. Not recommending.

address.streetAddress: Calle Galeana Norte 104

286794838.name: Beautiful hidden jewel
286794838.author: a TripAdvisor user
286794838.reviewBody: It is a very small place in a very narrow street, so it\u2019s easy to miss it, although it is very close from major landmarks such as the Cathedral and the city\u2019s main plaza; we found this place by wandering around and was a great find of calm in our trip, and since indulgencies are granted to devoted visitors to the Blessed Sacrament (such as in any other atoning temple) we did a quick visit. \n\nThe place worth a look by itself; it\u2019s a well-cared (although small), beautiful building with nice decoration and takes just a few minutes to see it all.

address.streetAddress: Calle Galeana Norte 104

674497331.name: The art of death
674497331.author: a TripAdvisor user
674497331.reviewBody:
I walked in to the museum expecting to be disappointed based on some of the reviews I had read.  Very happy to be wrong. 
I was absolutely delighted with the displays.  There are four permanent rooms covering prehispánica through to contemporary art. Each room offered treasures and amazing artefacts from the time period covered.  All of the displays and information were (unsurprisingly) in Spanish, not an insurmountable barrier to the non Spanish speaker, thanks to various translation apps that are available. 
The staff were friendly and helpful, the artefacts and displays amazing, and the museum itself was exquisite. 
My poor, long suffering spouse, who had no idea of what to expect, also enjoyed the visit. 
Well worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

643902727.name: Interesting
643902727.author: a TripAdvisor user
643902727.reviewBody: My husband and I visited this museum and we liked it. It\'s not an advanced museum like the one in NYC or Paris lol.  Most of the explanations were in Spanish so I wish they had it in English but we googled Mexican history and we are glad we visited this museum.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

625315050.name: Very Interesting... Give this a try!
625315050.author: a TripAdvisor user
625315050.reviewBody:
Sunday afternoon in Agua's so let's go find about the History of Mexican "Day Of The Dead" and how they worship their family members that pass away.
Easy to find, just a short walk from Plaza Patria.
Paid the $20 each and grabbed a short guide in English, as all the displays are in Spanish.
The museum is set in 6 or so separate rooms, I found some a little morbid - But's the MX culture so all in all very interesting.
I would recommend a trip here and really understand the believes they have.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

618055129.name: Disappointed
618055129.author: a TripAdvisor user
618055129.reviewBody: My main reason for visiting Aguascalientes was this museum, and it really disappointed me, because most of Mexico\'s more recent museums are really good. Maybe this happened because Aguascalientes does not have much of a connection to Day of the Dead, and it was just a cynical pliy to lure tourists to what I found to be a relatively drab and boring city?

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

608599146.name: Don\'t miss this
608599146.author: a TripAdvisor user
608599146.reviewBody: This is a very interesting museum. I found it to be fascinating, interesting and a little ghoulish. If you stay in the El Cento district this is a short walk. All the museums are very inexpensive.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

604826041.name: it was OK didnt blow my mind...
604826041.author: a TripAdvisor user
604826041.reviewBody: I was expecting more pictures of the day of the death in Michoacan or other cool cementaries in Mexico.......

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

585838439.name: Went in to pass time before the bus tour and ran short on time!
585838439.author: a TripAdvisor user
585838439.reviewBody: Has interesting expositions, when I went there was a room dedicated to digital art that was really mind-blowing. Overall I think they have well-balanced expositions, things you can look at and things you can learn from/of. The "descent into the underworld" section was pretty lame, but the rest more than compensated. If anything, lack of guided tours (at least we were not offered one) is the one thing I would "complain" about.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

563617126.name: Very interesting place
563617126.author: a TripAdvisor user
563617126.reviewBody: This wasn\u2019t exactly what I expected. I thought there would be more about the older civilisations. However, it does show a broad history and there are some really interesting exhibits. I think it\u2019s worth the trip. Only 20 pesos entry. Didn\u2019t open on time.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

546147883.name: Bizarre Museum.
546147883.author: a TripAdvisor user
546147883.reviewBody: A very interesting place. Death is definitely the theme . A good insight into the preoccupation with the devils.\n\n

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

541432150.name: Nice museum!
541432150.author: a TripAdvisor user
541432150.reviewBody: In San Marcos you can find this one. I liked very much. I did not know if it was 2th of november or it is always the same.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

541006644.name: Fascinating!
541006644.author: a TripAdvisor user
541006644.reviewBody: If you want to know more about the very special Mexican traditions and believes around death, this is the perfect place and makes a very interesting and enlightening visit. They should work on the shop tough, it was quite disappointing.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

527382754.name: A different kind of museum
527382754.author: a TripAdvisor user
527382754.reviewBody: It is a not so big museum with a different kind of exhibition of a very Mexican subject: The Death. The place is nice, deals with the death from several points of view but does not have an english translation. This is a problem because the subject attracts tourists and they do not understand better the exhibition because of this.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

517214252.name: Interesting Museum
517214252.author: a TripAdvisor user
517214252.reviewBody:
I thought the place was going to be morbid like the mummy museum in Guanajuato, but this museum is actually pretty interesting focusing on the culture around death instead of actual dead people.

There are many interesting exhibits of how Latin cultures depict death. There are also turn of the century photos of families with their dead family member. Another exhibit shows candelabras, masks, and belongings of the dead used during funerals. Another exhibit is all calaveras (skulls) made of different materials.

The museum has many clean and modern bathrooms, but no toilet paper.

When we went the museum was free.  The very small gift shop was closed.  It probably takes about an hour to see the museum.  It is not very large.  Visit the local meat markets nearby after touring the museum.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

488884180.name: Death Museum?
488884180.author: a TripAdvisor user
488884180.reviewBody: A small museum downtown. A must see when visiting Aguascalientes. A very unusual collection about burial customs, old-fashion custom of photographing dead relatives, and other art collections centered on death and dying. A unique nod to the home of Day of the Dead art icon, Posada.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

475835541.name: Amazing! Informative and fascinating!
475835541.author: a TripAdvisor user
475835541.reviewBody: I learned a lot at this museum, and I would have stayed there so much longer as there is so much to see! I loved that there was a lot to read about the history of Mexico and how the way people view death changed depending on the influence of different religions and cultures. It is definitely worth a visit to understand the Mexican culture better: I found it fascinating and I would like to visit it again! The people there were very helpful too, and there was always someone at the exit of each room to tell you which room to visit next!\n\nMuchas gracias! :-)

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

464251227.name: Nasty
464251227.author: a TripAdvisor user
464251227.reviewBody: I have been to 24 states and this place is just plan nasty. I wish I had not gone. I would not recommend that you go.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

445929758.name: Spooky place for a Mexican Tradition
445929758.author: a TripAdvisor user
445929758.reviewBody: Mexican tradition for the day of the dead wasn\'t so alive until yo came to Aguscalientes Dead Musueum and start digging about a mexican tradition

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

441787176.name: A nice look back into Mexico\'s mecabre
441787176.author: a TripAdvisor user
441787176.reviewBody: The National Museum of Death is colorful, poignant, mystical, political, contradictory, satirical, macabre and educational \u2013 all at the same time.\n\nCan see the whole museum in about an hour. I would highly recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

436417778.name: Gross
436417778.author: a TripAdvisor user
436417778.reviewBody: This is more of a gross exhibit than history. I considered it a waste of time and would not return again.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

434723856.name: Fascinating Museum at a Great Price
434723856.author: a TripAdvisor user
434723856.reviewBody: The museums in Mexico are great as the cost is less than $2 US and you can see the entire museum in an hour. This museum has interesting and unique artwork. It is in a great location in the center of town. The building is beautiful and it was enjoyable to explore the various rooms in the museum.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

404126455.name: Favorite in Northern Mexico
404126455.author: a TripAdvisor user
404126455.reviewBody: This is my daughter\'s favorite museum in Mexico. It gives you a good idea of the attitude towards death. There are photos of dead people and all sorts of arts and crafts pertaining to death. It was fun to see death given a light hearted perspective. Worth a visit for sure.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

397367730.name: Small but interesting
397367730.author: a TripAdvisor user
397367730.reviewBody: The Museum is relatively small and has some interesting artifacts.  Only takes about 20 minutes to go through.  Cost was small but I would not make an extra trip to go there.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

382031137.name: A place to visit...
382031137.author: a TripAdvisor user
382031137.reviewBody: WE had been really surprised about the museum.\nPlenty of art about the dead and the different view of it

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

371860388.name: Some interesting things to see
371860388.author: a TripAdvisor user
371860388.reviewBody: It was interesting to see the art, artifacts, photos and various memorabilia of the culture of death in Mexico. It probably took us about 1.5 hours to see it all and it wasn\'t very crowded.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

355013081.name: Fabulous - don\'t miss it!
355013081.author: a TripAdvisor user
355013081.reviewBody: Yhis is one of the most fascinating museums that you can imagine.  Tells specific stories of how death became celebrated rather than feared in the Latin American culture.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

351415562.name: All About the Dead
351415562.author: a TripAdvisor user
351415562.reviewBody: The museum was full of all kinds of things related to being dead, celebrating the dead and the history of handling the dead with a Mexican emphasis, as you would expect. Average for anyone who isn\'t into the whole "de la Muerte" thing, which I\'m not.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

350694979.name: Fascinating museum!
350694979.author: a TripAdvisor user
350694979.reviewBody: I loved my time there, although I wish I read more Spanish as there is no info in English. Very cool objects, painting, sculptures, etc from different eras and styles. They have a few Posada pieces, but for that you should really head over to the Posada museum a few blocks south. Really well-done, simple museum.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

340792412.name: Some Spanish Required
340792412.author: a TripAdvisor user
340792412.reviewBody: Interesting museum depicting how death is celebrated in Mexico from various time periods.  The artifacts are well presented and in my opinion is worth a visit.  The only downside it that the descriptors in the museum are in Spanish only although you are given a brochure in English that does give an overview of what you will see in each area.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

326939734.name: Small, nice collection
326939734.author: a TripAdvisor user
326939734.reviewBody: I visited on Nov 3, and I enjoyed the collections of Catrinas and other D\u00eda de Los Muertos art. Entry was only 20 pesos. There are about 4 small rooms with small sculptures, masks, etc. It only takes about an hour to see everything, two if you read everything. Various ofrendas were set up in the indoor lobby courtyard area. They were already taking them down on Nov 3, so plan to visit late Oct through Nov 2 if you want to see the Day Of The Dead special highlights.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

324304538.name: A look into the culture of death in Mexico
324304538.author: a TripAdvisor user
324304538.reviewBody: Very visual so your Spanish does not have to be good, could actually be non-existent! Excellent (temporary?) exhibit about Max Aub & Adolfo Mexiac. Located in an interesting building too.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

321400871.name: A must for all Goths
321400871.author: a TripAdvisor user
321400871.reviewBody: What an odd place to be visiting! Very interring and lots of Mexican history mixed with the death obsession. I was in Aguascalientes a week before the festival of the dead when everyone dresses a a skeleton and parties! So going here put this strange seeming obsession with death into some perspective.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

310548499.name: A different view to death
310548499.author: a TripAdvisor user
310548499.reviewBody: A particular museum that offers you how Mexican culture and indigenous groups, and around the world, see death in their culture.\n\nNot scary at all, but an educating and learning experience. This is a museum you don\'t want to miss.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

298504882.name: Classic
298504882.author: a TripAdvisor user
298504882.reviewBody: This museum has a wide range of images of death - some are gruesome, some macabre, some merely pedestrian.  There is a lot of prehispanic material on display.  Jose Guadalupe Posada was born in AGU and so you can see a lot of his paintings in the Museum and in his own museum.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

246636290.name: Authentic and Worthwhile
246636290.author: a TripAdvisor user
246636290.reviewBody: This  is quite different from the Museum of Death I visited on Hollywood Blvd in Los Angeles. This one in Aguascalientes has excellent Day of the Dead pieces, pre-colonial death masks and other old and unique death displays that are thought provoking. Their more recent collection of death-related material is a yawn at best, but their older more serious collection makes up for it. On the contrary, the Hollywood museum has an incredible collection related to the newness of death, while their pre-historic material is minimal. I would love to see the two collaborate. Throw in a third collaborator, the Museum of Torture in downtown Mexico City, and you\'ve got an international blockbuster tour.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

240981676.name: Very interesting Prehispanic pieces!
240981676.author: a TripAdvisor user
240981676.reviewBody: I happened to be there around Day of the Death.  They had a huge altar outside the ticket booth and people were paying respect. Once inside the museum, I liked the old prehispanic pieces showing how natives to Mexico perceived death. not so much the newer pieces.  At the end they have a world map showing the many ways people around the world perceive death, it was very interesting too,

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

229686967.name: Color me a bit disappointed
229686967.author: a TripAdvisor user
229686967.reviewBody: I came to Aguascalientes specifically to see this museum (I was en route to San Luis Potosi from Zacateca), so perhaps my expectations were too high. I am a huge Katrina fan, love all things day of the dead, am fascinated by the way death is treated in Mexico as opposed to the way we gringos do. But this museum didn\'t do it for me. It seemed more like a random selection of death-related "stuff" than a carefully curated collection of folk art.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

216449480.name: This was different
216449480.author: a TripAdvisor user
216449480.reviewBody: This was a strange museum but very well done.\nThere were guides there helping with every thing.\nWell worth a visit

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

206539044.name: Pure Mexicana.
206539044.author: a TripAdvisor user
206539044.reviewBody: The artwork and culture on display here is amazing. Very fine pieces dealing with demise, yet so full of life in form and color. I can say they are even happy.\nThis is not a place that intends to creep you out, or be in anyway morose. Celebrating death is a huge part of Mexico, as well as other countries south of the border. Come here for a better understanding of this bit of culture. Believe it or not, this a fun and lively place.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

189418732.name: Fascinatingly morbid
189418732.author: a TripAdvisor user
189418732.reviewBody: For the right person, this could be a very interesting cultural experience. I, however, was not able to make it through the museum. The morbidity of it truly affected me so much so that I had to leave shortly after arriving. The group I was with (several of which were nurses) found it fascinating and had to be convinced to leave much later! It is definitely worth checking out to see if it is for you.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

189406536.name: NICE WAY TO SEE HOW MEXICO VIEWS DEATH
189406536.author: a TripAdvisor user
189406536.reviewBody: Overall this is a nice museum to spend 1-2 hours in. Unique experience!.. there is Lots of art on display and best of all its inexpensive!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

186023396.name: Morbid museum, but it is part of our culture
186023396.author: a TripAdvisor user
186023396.reviewBody: It was fascinating to realize that the attraction to death goes back to the pre-columbian era.\nit as a vast collection of art craft and modern art pieces. Besides, you are visiting the original building of the oldest University of the city!\nNot suitable for small children for obvious reasons.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

185420615.name: El Museo Nacional de la Muerte
185420615.author: a TripAdvisor user
185420615.reviewBody: This museum is very intersting. Even if you\'re not familiar with the theme, you\'ll still enjoy all of the art pieces there are small descriptions and some history behind the death theme in Mexican Culture. All of the descriptions are in Spanish though. Really enjoyed the different Katrina\'s

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

183590360.name: Really entertaining
183590360.author: a TripAdvisor user
183590360.reviewBody: If you understand the basic significance of "el muerto" in Mexican culture you will love this museum. It is basic but has a terrific collection of "calavera" (skeleton) art divided into three rooms of pre-Columbian, art and religious artifacts. The creativity of many of these pieces is a real delight. Admission is very inexpensive.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

181165525.name: An very unique museum portraying death as it is seen by Mexicans
181165525.author: a TripAdvisor user
181165525.reviewBody: I really recommend this museum, it is very unique and it gives you an idea on how death is perceived in the Mexican culture from its prehispanic to modern times, don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

175459589.name: Well worth a visit
175459589.author: a TripAdvisor user
175459589.reviewBody: It\'s small, but well curated and in a interesting building. From pre-columbian artefacts, Posada\'s Catrina and new artists, a little of everything related to the Mexican cavaleras can be seen here.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

156032559.name: Talking in depth of death in the Mexican culture
156032559.author: a TripAdvisor user
156032559.reviewBody: I went to the museum with uncertainty of what I was going to see. It is beautiful. A big collection of all related to death worship and folklore. All sorts of handcrafts, from prehispanic archeological pieces to contemporary paintings. It\'s all there. No wonder why this museum is part of the school of arts. I would say this is a must when going to Aguascalientes.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

146224838.name: Not what I expected
146224838.author: a TripAdvisor user
146224838.reviewBody: This museum is not what you might think it is. I thought it was going to cover life and death, but it\'s actually a collection of Mexican art starting from the 1980\'s. I was hoping to see objects of death from historical periods. So don\'t expect a gruesome collection of morbid photos or death scenes. The prices to enter Mexican museums is very low, so take advantage and come take a look since you will be in the area.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

138022456.name: Very well designed exhibits made this worthwhile
138022456.author: a TripAdvisor user
138022456.reviewBody: Being from a country where death is considered quite taboo this museum I just had to visit. It was well designed and had a modern look to it. Although they only had things in Spanish (with no English or other common languages on the informative signs) it was still a great experience even if  non-spanish speakers can only view, not read, the exhibits. If they had English signs than I would give this a full 5-stars. Various facinating things to see!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

131052128.name: Wonderful collection
131052128.author: a TripAdvisor user
131052128.reviewBody: Wonderful collection on how different cultures treat death.  Definately worth the visit.  Very nicely collaborated museum.  There is an elevator to all floors for those who have trouble with stairs.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

125294370.name: All Things Death
125294370.author: a TripAdvisor user
125294370.reviewBody: Overwhelming array of death related art from pre-hispanic artifacts through to modern paintings, prints, figurines and esoterica. Not for everybody, but not at all morbid. Offers a window into the Mexican thinking about death.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

123047637.name: Amazing place to see
123047637.author: a TripAdvisor user
123047637.reviewBody: The building itself is a feast, one of the oldest convents in the colony.  Also the Aztec skull displayed is among only 7 in the world, and the colonial death, religious art collection is superb.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

121271222.name: J Gpe posada
121271222.author: a TripAdvisor user
121271222.reviewBody: I went to eat food from yucatan and it was delicious but the museum is quite big and I seen before,Mr posada did laugh at death,We as mexicans see it with some humor some not understable by other cultures,any I love it max

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

118432768.name: strange, interesting, amazing
118432768.author: a TripAdvisor user
118432768.reviewBody: This is a museum that you should go to. Mexico has a long story of dealing with death, we make it part of our traditions, we even make fun of it!. The museum is in an beautifull historic building, by itself its a must. The exposition is divided in different historic periods, and how we delt with death, from  prehispanic period  to our time, The exposition filled with amazing sculptures, paintings, and crafts, takes you around the building, ending in the newest adaptation. Simply stunning!!!

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

101814081.name: kind of weird, but deep philosophy of living
101814081.author: a TripAdvisor user
101814081.reviewBody: Went there by suggestion on somebody from this website. Death is kind scary for everybody but Mexicans celebrate it with a very exquisite meaning and philosophy. what was somehow a simple visit to a simple place turned to be in a very delighting and exquisite experience of life and grace. really would recommend this place, is a must in Aguascalientes. Sunday is free but i would pay for going again. it is a visit for an hour and you can take pictures (without flash). My only complaint is that is not that big and you really keep willing for more.

address.streetAddress: a un Costado del Templo de San Diego

397102511.name: Great place for kids and adults
397102511.author: a TripAdvisor user
397102511.reviewBody: It is a small science museum but very well maintained. Imax was great. The dinosaur exhibition is too small but my daughter loved the rock climbing wall. My three year old loved this exhibition of course. The planet earth was too much information for both of my kids after running through the museum. It is really nice but maybe for one of the first activiities of the day. After seeing the Nissan facilities in Aguascalientes I think they REALLY ran short in their exhibition. I wish they would invest more in education. :)  They have a beautiful park which would be great for a picnic. \nAnd they were working on the butterfly and orchid garden. So I hope I can come back again soon. \n

itemReviewed.name: Descubre Museo Interactivo de Ciencias y Tecnologia

address.streetAddress: Av. San Miguel s/n, Col. Jardines del Parque

320250666.name: Very Nice Science Museum
320250666.author: a TripAdvisor user
320250666.reviewBody: Interesting Museum for Kids and family !\nThey have an Imax Thatre with outstanding films.\nNice modern architecture, very convenient located between downtown and south of the city

itemReviewed.name: Descubre Museo Interactivo de Ciencias y Tecnologia

address.streetAddress: Av. San Miguel s/n, Col. Jardines del Parque

298506024.name: Well worth the trip
298506024.author: a TripAdvisor user
298506024.reviewBody: Aguascalientes was a logistics town where railroads in Mexico intersected - it is now an industrial city with aspirations.   This museum and the railroad museum nearby are both work the trip.  It has a series of interactive displays which rivals it with places like Lawrence in Berkeley or the Exploratorium in San Francisco.   Our grandson loved this.

itemReviewed.name: Descubre Museo Interactivo de Ciencias y Tecnologia

address.streetAddress: Av. San Miguel s/n, Col. Jardines del Parque

644165702.name: Compact museum with a good overview of local history
644165702.author: a TripAdvisor user
644165702.reviewBody: Located close to the centre and set in a colonial era building with interesting architecture, this Museo provides a good overview of local history and how the area has evolved through until today. All explanations are in spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

488557772.name: nice, interesting
488557772.author: a TripAdvisor user
488557772.reviewBody: interesting museum,  but no English explanations. thank god for my smartphone.   everything from prehistory to,  well,  history.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

436418213.name: Ok
436418213.author: a TripAdvisor user
436418213.reviewBody: This was okay. The last exhibit was the best one. In the first there was some misinformation about horses.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

278330427.name: One of the best regional museums I have ever visited.
278330427.author: a TripAdvisor user
278330427.reviewBody: This is perhaps among the best regional museums that i have been to - it rivals the Sacramento History museum in depth and coverage.   It is worth also going to the Railroad museum in the area.   Aguascalientes is at the center of the country and also at the center of many key periods in the political, social and industrial history of Mexico.   And this museum presents those trends in a compelling way.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

162973829.name: Interesting Museum
162973829.author: a TripAdvisor user
162973829.reviewBody: This Museum tells a lot about the city. Lots of paintings and pictures to see into the past. And lots of little shops outside the Museum that are nice to bring back to your friends and family. I recommend going to this location.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

128143966.name: Quite a gem
128143966.author: a TripAdvisor user
128143966.reviewBody:
I found this museum while walking along a beautiful street.  The museum has artifacts from the history of Mexico.  The guides are polite and will answer any questions.  They are always happy to give a tour and explain the items in the museum.  

One thing I found entrancing about this museum was the photographic exhibit on "La Muerte Nina".  Their specialized exhibits are great, unique.  

Sundays the Museum is free, closed Mondays, all other days it is 42 pesos.

Wonderful museum housed in a building that in itself is a museum to study and admire the architecture.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Regional de Historia de Aguascalientes

address.streetAddress: Peatonal Venustiano Carranza 118 Zona Centro

618055586.name: Beautiful building
618055586.author: a TripAdvisor user
618055586.reviewBody: This museum is housed in a really lovely building, most likely a former mansion, but there was nothing particularly special or interesting on display. Most cities I\'ve visited in Mexico I would gladly visit again. Aguascalientes is not one of them.

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

436418879.name: quant
436418879.author: a TripAdvisor user
436418879.reviewBody: This was a quant place that cost five pesos. It was a nice one hour visit. Simple but great to combine with other close things.

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

414414826.name: Building amazing, art exhibit ok
414414826.author: a TripAdvisor user
414414826.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this building. There were 2 courtyards. One had a garden and a fountain and a gorgeous stained glass piece of art.  The courtyard was stunning and peaceful.  There were many places to sit and enjoy the courtyard. The details on the columns were intricate. The architecture and details of the building itself were worth the visit.  The art exhibit was just ok. There were 4 rooms to walk through but they weren\'t filled.  The museum felt a bit empty. Some of the art on display were replicas.  I don\'t go to a museum to see a replica of the original piece.

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

308387658.name: Beautiful building and representative exposition
308387658.author: a TripAdvisor user
308387658.reviewBody: You do not have to take the whole afternoon to see a beautiful building and see beautiful Aguascalientes art. I recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

233370460.name: Beautiful building
233370460.author: a TripAdvisor user
233370460.reviewBody: The building that houses this building is exquisite, with graceful columns, lovely little gardens and patios and fountains. And as Aguascalientes is more than a little off the touristic trail (not without reason...) I pretty much had it to myself.

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

123048085.name: Museum of Art of the City
123048085.author: a TripAdvisor user
123048085.reviewBody: Medium in size of collection in comparison to larger art museums, the building itself its superb, the patios are so splendid that is worth a visit just to see the greek temple resemblant architecture of the building.  Although the artwork is mostly paintings and sculpture, makes up for its finnesse!

address.streetAddress: Zaragoza 505

667428732.name: Beautiful Castle.
667428732.author: a TripAdvisor user
667428732.reviewBody:
Took a trip here as was off to see the Templo San MArcos and this is a few minutes way away...
Only to find that it is closed due to renovations!
What a shame - (April 17th 2019)
Managed to take a peak over the fence and yep - Looks lovely.
I will try to find out why it's closed and maybe try to visit again!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rivero y Gutierrez casi esquina Zaragoza

544074621.name: A castle you cannot really see
544074621.author: a TripAdvisor user
544074621.reviewBody: They closed it, so I couldn\'t see anything. I\'m short too, so that does not help. It looks like nobody takes care of it or cleans it. It now has graffiti.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rivero y Gutierrez casi esquina Zaragoza

436956320.name: Closed
436956320.author: a TripAdvisor user
436956320.reviewBody: It really is closed. You can see the building through the gate. If you adventuresome you can climb up on a second gate and get a good picture over the roof. You cannot actually get anywhere close to the building. My sons enjoyed it because they got a few pictures. But you couldn\'t get close.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rivero y Gutierrez casi esquina Zaragoza

436141979.name: Castillo
436141979.author: a TripAdvisor user
436141979.reviewBody: My wife and I visites this castle on Nov. It was under construction and no one was allowed on the property. It was privately owned and construction was to be completed by 2018. I would not recommend stopping by, unless you don\'t mind taking photos from the sidewalk through a ten foot fence. But still a beautiful castle if you are lucky enough to look at it from up close.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rivero y Gutierrez casi esquina Zaragoza

354693597.name: Tiny castle in downtown Aguascalientes!
354693597.author: a TripAdvisor user
354693597.reviewBody:
If you are a fan of family history, architecture, then you must visit Castillo Douglas, that is next to "Chalet Douglas" and Templo de San Antonio.
I search in Wilkipedia, and they said that it was built in the late 1800 by a family that came from Scotland. 
Sadly, the castle has been abandoned, and you can see through the gate, what still remains.
The street is really beautiful, has some old houses...

address.streetAddress: Calle Rivero y Gutierrez casi esquina Zaragoza

494890309.name: Interested death view through Mexico Ages
494890309.author: a TripAdvisor user
494890309.reviewBody: To understand and love Mexico you must get deeper into their vision of death. Sadness, happiness, loneliness,joy, party,religion ALL together!

address.streetAddress: Rivero y Gutierrez Jose Maria Morelos

369390784.name: A very good collection of art and handicrafts related to death
369390784.author: a TripAdvisor user
369390784.reviewBody: I spent a couple of hours in Museo Nacional de la Muerte in April of 2016.  The museum consists of several salons with various forms of art or handicrafts related to the Mexican concept of death.  The photos of historical events were quite good --- Emiliano Zapata just after being assassinated, orphans visiting their mother\'s grave, firing squads during the Revolution.  I recommend this museum as providing an insight into the Mexican concept of death.  It\'s not gruesome or scary, it\'s educational and interesting.

address.streetAddress: Rivero y Gutierrez Jose Maria Morelos

665555880.name: Pregunta
665555880.author: a TripAdvisor user
665555880.reviewBody: Hola Buenas tardes quiero saber si abren el s\u00e1bado 20 de abril ya que es S\u00e1bado de Gloria por favor  ?

address.streetAddress: Road to Agostaderito

659663808.name: QUE BELLEZA SE LUGAR.
659663808.author: a TripAdvisor user
659663808.reviewBody: Si te gusta la naturaleza tienes que conocerlo, es un lugar en verdad hermoso, adem\u00e1s sales de la ciudad.

address.streetAddress: Road to Agostaderito

656412969.name: Para no volver!
656412969.author: a TripAdvisor user
656412969.reviewBody: Fuimos el fin de semana al el parque el Sabinal por "recomendaci\u00f3n" tur\u00edstica pero la verdad no tiene nada de tur\u00edstico ir a un lugar donde llegan grupos de borrachos a las 12pm con el ruidero de sus "autoest\u00e9reos" y aparte que fuimos en temporada de calor estaba todo enlodado lleno de charcos de agua estancada, si de por s\u00ed el r\u00edo que pasa por ah\u00ed es muy sucio con el agua estancada est\u00e1 peor! Aparte de que cobran la entrada todo est\u00e1 muy da\u00f1ado y los asadores que te dicen que puedes ocupar est\u00e1n llenos de comida pegada de qui\u00e9n sabe cu\u00e1ntos d\u00edas antes aparte de que si caminas por el parque te vas a encontrar 2 o 3 parejas echando pasi\u00f3n al aire libre... Y borrachos por todos lados! P\u00e9simo!!

address.streetAddress: Road to Agostaderito

623522765.name: Para convivir con la naturaleza
623522765.author: a TripAdvisor user
623522765.reviewBody: Pocos lugares existen en Aguascalientes para convivir con la naturaleza, el Sabinal es una excelente opci\u00f3n para acampar, estar con la familia, caminar y respirar aire puro.

address.streetAddress: Road to Agostaderito

594674471.name: Convivencia con la Naturaleza
594674471.author: a TripAdvisor user
594674471.reviewBody:
Es un parque ecológico de 160 hectáreas, cuenta con enormes y viejos sabinos, así como el Pirúl y el Sauce. Es una zona de recreación familiar a la orilla de un río que es una ramificación del rio San Pedro, lamentablemente se ha convertido en un río de aguas negras, sin embargo la belleza de este lugar es impresionante y muy rara en Aguascalientes. Si se busca un momento de relajación se recomienda ir a pasear entre semana ya que los fines de semana se abarrota por decenas de familias que acuden a convivir.
El parque cuenta con asadores, bancas y algunos juegos, así como una cancha de fut bol y algunos baños públicos. En el lugar, si se es cauteloso, se podrán observar algunas ranas, patos, víboras, ardillas y algunos caballos domésticos.
Es un lugar fresco y muy tranquilo, la población del pueblito es muy pequeña y en ella se pueden encontrar algunos lugares para comer algo delicioso.
Esta zona también es muy frecuentada por fotógrafos profesionales que aprovechan el paisaje para hacer algunas sesiones con modelos.
Sin duda es uno de los lugares que no se pueden dejar sin visitar si se visita Aguascalientes.

address.streetAddress: Road to Agostaderito

438293298.name: Museo Magico
438293298.author: a TripAdvisor user
438293298.reviewBody: A pretty, little local house with some architectonical highlights and nice eclectic interior design. The guide (and owner) shows you in five little rooms his private collection of the "good old times" in Aguascalientes and tells you background information about Posada, dia de los muertos, vintage toys, religion, plants, lifestyle, you name it. The rooms range from some well selected pieces to fully packed rooms with skeletons & toys. The highlight is the guide itself, who is showing you around with a lot of joy and kindness. He is running this museum by itself without government help. The entrance is free, but a tip is recommended. Not many tourists make it to this place, so yo can enjoy this hidden place without any hustle.

address.streetAddress: Calle Pedro Parga 228 Zona Centro

667031030.name: Beautiful!!!
667031030.author: a TripAdvisor user
667031030.reviewBody:
Just outside the rear entrance of Jardin San Marcos across the plaza is this beautiful Church, simply stunning!
Take a walk around the outside and admire all the intricate details that are high up... the Gargoyles too!
Then venture inside and be amazed!
I went into the small hall on the left side and WOW just beautiful.
Highly recommend a look!!!

297540470.name: The heart of the city. Beautiful!!
297540470.author: a TripAdvisor user
297540470.reviewBody: This is literally the heart of Aguascalientes, tourists and locals alike stroll through the Church and San Marcos Park just nest to it. The Church is very well preserved and we were lucky to see a wedding there so the atmosphere was brilliant!\n\nWell worth a visit.

261344945.name: Historical Church ... most famed as the center of the Festival de San Marcos festivities!
261344945.author: a TripAdvisor user
261344945.reviewBody: Historical Church ... most famed as the center of the Festival de San Marcos festivities!\n\nIt is where the processions start and where the pedestrian way between the Church and the Plaza de Toros is located ... very historical and must see if you are visiting Aguascalientes.

227333960.name: awesome
227333960.author: a TripAdvisor user
227333960.reviewBody: beautiful maintained and clean gardens, peaceful and interesting. Every year in April they have huge fair, \'Feria de San Marcos\'.  otherwise the church plaza is usually full of activity with stands to buy souvenirs and experience the culture.

162983110.name: i loved the garden
162983110.author: a TripAdvisor user
162983110.reviewBody: Got a nice garden there, great view, and awesome ice cream, i ate twice, the people inside were really firendly

145191251.name: Beutiful Landmark
145191251.author: a TripAdvisor user
145191251.reviewBody: This church is in a great location to enjoy the city.  The bullfight arena is very close with alot of street vendors out in the streets.  Very safe area.

542109247.name: Super-packed and dirty!!!
542109247.author: a TripAdvisor user
542109247.reviewBody: The entrance fee is really affordable, even for the lowest income earners in the area, so the place was packed beyond any believe. This is the place where one can appreciate the density of population in Mexico. We arrived late, around 11 AM, every parcel of grass, every bit of a tree shade was already taken, but not sure we would have wanted to stay anyway - every square meter was taken by a family. Toward noon it simply became too dirty to be there: watermelon seeds, pieces of paper, food, diapers (dirty?) next to food stalls, it was just too much. Every pool, every puddle of water, had thousands of people in it, rubbing shoulders with each other. Water in the "Olympic" pool was so murky, I could not see the bottom of the pool, and it was just 1.5 or 1.6 m deep. It is not easy to disgust me, but it was one of the worst experience I really ever had during my leisure time. Lines for two water slides were enormous, had to wait 15 minutes to get it, and then got a burn on my back due to the poor quality of joins in the slide. We left not spending even two hours and I am sure we will not go back.

address.streetAddress: Emiliano Zapata - Valladolid Km No. 5

320251069.name: Water Park for the Family.
320251069.author: a TripAdvisor user
320251069.reviewBody: This Water Park is regular, not so cheap, but not very clean,\nmany customers, crowded and many teenagers recklessly jumps and runs without caring of small kids.

address.streetAddress: Emiliano Zapata - Valladolid Km No. 5

140602844.name: nice little gem  aguascalientes
140602844.author: a TripAdvisor user
140602844.reviewBody: this is a great place to spend a lazy day....the kiddie pool is fun fun fun for all ages.....the large pool is huge....you never feel crowded.....the grounds are beautiful....and you can take your own picnic.....the waters feel as if your aches and pains are slowly healing the minute you get in....a wonderful place to spend with your soulmate, family, friends, grandchildren, and i often go alone to be mentally pampered.....

address.streetAddress: Emiliano Zapata - Valladolid Km No. 5

128143774.name: What a pleasant surprise.
128143774.author: a TripAdvisor user
128143774.reviewBody:
A very nice water park, quite a pleasant surprise.  Tons of swimming pools for all interests, kid pools with slides, adult pools, an olympic pool for laps.  Very family oriented yet I went as a couple and felt completely comfortable.  

I have psoriasis and my companion broke his back last year, we both swear this water parked helped us immensely.  The warm waters without chlorine helped my skin, he exercised in the pools and agrees this helped his back and legs feel better.  

We met another woman who said she goes here three times a week just for recreation and health.  

The water was between 85-90 degrees F (just a guess).  

You can bring your own picnic lunches with food or drinks, or purchase them there.  

What a wonderful find!

address.streetAddress: Emiliano Zapata - Valladolid Km No. 5

670144464.name: La mejor Experiencia Culinaria desde la cr\u00eda hasta la mesa !
670144464.author: a TripAdvisor user
670144464.reviewBody:
Cuando se planea un viaje a la feria de Aguascalientes, jamas te imaginas que esta experiencia exista. Los propietarios del Rancho Ubuntu han decidido romper con las malas e insalubres prácticas en la cría de la carne de Borrego y Cordero, logrando un proceso certificado JALAL (carne producida con los mas altos estándares de alimentación, crianza y sacrificio) y un producto delicioso!. La experiencia incluye una explicación completa del proceso y se puede solicitar un banquete en el mismo rancho. Lo mas importante es que los propietarios, han puesto todo el corazón en este proyecto para que conozcamos las prácticas correctas de producción de carne y reflexionemos lo que al día de hoy, nuestros hijos y nosotros consumimos.  

A solo 30 minutos de la ciudad de Aguascalientes, Rancho Ubuntu recibe a sus visitantes toda la semana. Adicionalmente han desarrollado programas sociales para dar empleo y capacitación a personas de las comunidades locales, lo que los hace únicos y un modelo de negocio y social incomparable. 

Recomiendo mucho que lo visiten y pasen una mañana y tarde agradable llena de aprendizaje y un deleite al paladar.

668493351.name: Experiencia Halal
668493351.author: a TripAdvisor user
668493351.reviewBody:
Se puede aprender todo el proceso de la preparación del cordero, desde crianza hasta la mesa.
Tienen excelentes estándares de calidad, buena explicación.
La finalidad de este rancho es extraordinaria  buscan un fin muy bueno para la sociedad.
Comida deliciosa, buena bebida y el postre increíble.
Desde el registro reciben con un gran gesto y un detallito

658361347.name: Una experiencia extraordinaria!
658361347.author: a TripAdvisor user
658361347.reviewBody: Rancho Ubuntu es el \u00fanico rancho productor de cordero con certificaci\u00f3n Halal, quiz\u00e1 eso sea una excentricidad pero en verdad es sorprendente poder conocer de mano de sus fundadores un aut\u00e9ntico universo de informaci\u00f3n, cultura y t\u00e9cnicas para producir este nivel de c\u00e1lidad. La experiencia fue muy constructiva y dio paso a un agasajo gastron\u00f3mico de la mejor talla. Con productos originarios del rancho acompa\u00f1ados por una muy minuciosa selecci\u00f3n de productos de la regi\u00f3n, disfrutamos de un men\u00fa fuera de serie. Ha sido una experiencia memorable que con gusto repetir\u00eda, encontr\u00e9 nuevos amigos en Ubuntu y un motivo m\u00e1s para recomendar que vengan a Aguascalientes!!

658360943.name: Lamb-tour
658360943.author: a TripAdvisor user
658360943.reviewBody: Excelente lugar para pasar un domingo diferente, exquisita comida y un gran servicio por parte de todo el equipo, 100% recomendable!

291849854.name: Beautiful venue
291849854.author: a TripAdvisor user
291849854.reviewBody: Even though the Aguascalientes theater is bigger and newer, the Morelos theater is more important in terms of history value

address.streetAddress: Calle Nieto 113 Plaza De La Patria S/N, Centro

622981161.name: Awesome!!!
622981161.author: a TripAdvisor user
622981161.reviewBody:
Saw an advert on a door at the mall.. Free tickets for a Sunday of car racing at the Autodrome... 
So went into the mall and found the store - asked ofr 2 tickets and indeed I got 2 free tickets for a Sunday race day!
Awesome!
Rocked up on the Sunday at 11:30... paid $50 to park the car - Took a seat and watched the practice..
Racing started at 12:30 - Good action! The oval was hcanged and a chicane added - this made for more action...
4 classes racing Moto's 300cc aand 600cc, Cars V8... and GT4's.
Sat on the concrete stands - Take a pillow next time! Also need an umbrella as is so exposed.
Also take your own food and water..
$25 for a 300 ml bottle of water too much! $10 for 500ml from OXXO.
Great view good action.
Bring on the NASCAR later this month

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Internacional Tanque de los Jiménez

261345784.name: Went to the "Los antiguos ba\u00f1os Ojocaliente" and they were great!
261345784.author: a TripAdvisor user
261345784.reviewBody: Went to the "Los antiguos ba\u00f1os Ojocaliente" and they were great! They are private Roman-Style baths that are over 200 years old and run off of a real thermal spring.\n\nWonderful private tiled baths ... great for relaxation in Aguascalientes.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

531626171.name: Aprovechando La Estancia
531626171.author: a TripAdvisor user
531626171.reviewBody:
Partido Necaxa & Querétaro jornada 11
Estadio casi vacío pero en buen estado
Las butacas muy incómodas
La tienda de souvenirs muy surtida y las empleadas amables
Muy cerca del Gran Hotel Alameda..

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

519088890.name: Mal por la administraci\u00f3n del Necaxa
519088890.author: a TripAdvisor user
519088890.reviewBody:
El partido al cual acudimos a este estadio, hacíamos en calidad de visitante.

Debíamos ingresar por la puerta 9, el taxi nos deja sobre la avenida y de ahí a la puerta son 80 metros aproximadamente, como llevábamos la camiseta del rival, los policías del acceso nos impidieron el paso, argumentando que en ese acceso solo se podía ingresar con auto.

Otro grupo de aficionados era acompañado por una mujer embarazada, tampoco a ella le permitieron el paso, le dijimos al policía, que la dejara pasar solo a ella y a alguien que la acompañara, el argumento fue, "le hace bien caminar, que de la vuelta"

Bajo este argumento, pueril, estupido y nefasto, debimos darle toda la vuelta al estadio, literal, toda la vuelta.

Pésima organización, pésima actitud.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

501273192.name: Un estadio moderno y funcional.
501273192.author: a TripAdvisor user
501273192.reviewBody: Es el coraz\u00f3n deportivo de la ciudad, donde juega el equipo de primera divisi\u00f3n, Necaxa.\nEs un estadio funcional pues tiene muchas rutas de llegada por cualquier punto de la ciudad, zonas de entrada y salida (adem\u00e1s de las taquillas) con bastante \u00e1rea para r\u00e1pida circulaci\u00f3n, y dentro del estadio las zonas son r\u00e1pidamente accesibles, tanto para entrar como para salir.\nMuy recomendable asistir a disfrutar del f\u00fatbol o de alg\u00fan concierto que ah\u00ed se presente.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

482315834.name: Excelente opci\u00f3n
482315834.author: a TripAdvisor user
482315834.reviewBody: Una excelente opci\u00f3n si visitas aguascalientes, uno de los mejores estadios del f\u00fatbol que hay en el pa\u00eds, su arquitectura es una r\u00e9plica a un estadio del f\u00fatbol Ingles \nSin duda una opci\u00f3n muy buena, lo recomiendo ampliamente, en el interior venden cerveza, refrescos, palomitas, papas, sabritas y estan a precio accesibles

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

474661393.name: Excelente estadio
474661393.author: a TripAdvisor user
474661393.reviewBody: Un lugar ideal para idea con familia. Es incre\u00edble que se pueda disfrutar de estos espect\u00e1culos en familia. Completa seguridad y tranquilidad. Estando sentado en un c\u00f3modo asiento se acercan los vendedores y puedes comer o tomar algo. Ahora que el Necaxa esta en primera en nivel de los equipos visitantes es much\u00edsimo mejor. Recomiendo las butacas detr\u00e1s de los bancos de los jugadores.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

465892392.reviewBody: Fuimos a ver el juego de Rayados vs Necaxa. El estadio esta mas o menos, lo que s\u00ed es que es un lugar muy seguro. Ojal\u00e1 podamos ir pronto de nuevo! Aguascalientes es un lugar muy bello. La rayotienda estaba muy cool tienen muchos souvenirs muy lindos.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

355044131.name: Estadio Familiar
355044131.author: a TripAdvisor user
355044131.reviewBody: El estadio De futbol Victoria, sede del equipo Rayos del Necaxa de Aguascalientes, fue construido cuando el equipo Necaxa cambi\u00f3 su sede de la ciudad de M\u00e9xico a la ciudad de Aguascalientes, se construyo sobre un viejo campo de futbol, por lo que su ubicaci\u00f3n qued\u00f3 en una zona muy c\u00e9ntrica de la ciudad, de arquitectura muy moderna con capacidad para 25,000 espectadores c\u00f3modamente sentados. \nSi usted visita esta ciudad y le gusta el futbol, vale la pena conocer este estadio, el ambiente es 100% familiar y los precios de los boletos muy accesibles por tratarse de un equipo que actualmente milita en la liga de primera "A".\nEl estacionamiento es un poco problem\u00e1tico, les recomiendo llegar en taxi.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

239328729.name: Buen estadio, mal equipo
239328729.author: a TripAdvisor user
239328729.reviewBody: El estadio como tal es muy bueno, de los m\u00e1s funcionales del pa\u00eds, tiene curiosidades como las fuentes danzantes que se encienden cuando mete un gol el equipo local. Desafortunadamente, el descenso del equipo a la segunda divisi\u00f3n (primera a) ha hecho que el mantenimiento en los alrededores haya deca\u00eddo en los \u00faltimos a\u00f1os y se empieza a notar el abandono en algunos espacios. De cualquier forma se puede pasar una tarde agradable, si no nos interesa demasiado el partido.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

236129001.name: Estadio muy c\u00f3modo
236129001.author: a TripAdvisor user
236129001.reviewBody: Me parece un estadio en general seguro, muy c\u00f3modo, con muy buena visibilidad y de muy f\u00e1cil acceso, relativamente cerca del centro de Aguascalientes, se puede llegar caminando desde la Plaza Patria. Antes o despu\u00e9s del partido uno se puede ir a disfrutar del Parque Tres Centurias que est\u00e1 muy cerca y ver los ferrocarriles. A mi gusto es uno de los mejores estadios de M\u00e9xico.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

233128964.name: Los cambio no siempre son buenos......
233128964.author: a TripAdvisor user
233128964.reviewBody: Llevo a\u00f1os asistiendo a ver a mis rayos, una ya estaba acostumbrado a los horarios y zonas del estadio, ahora con la nueva administraci\u00f3n los cambios no me agradaron, el cambio de zonas terminan desfavoreciendo a personas como nosotros que no somos de aguascalientes y por lo tanto no tenemos la certeza de asistir o comprar bonos, el horario es de hueva, acabas de comer el sol esta a plomo y terminas durmiendo si no dan espect\u00e1culo en la cancha, en fin me gustaba m\u00e1s antes....

Con las fuentes, las instalaciones, las butacas y los accesibles precios, es, sin duda, uno de los mejores estadios de M\u00e9xico.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

159742834.name: Excelente zona
159742834.author: a TripAdvisor user
159742834.reviewBody: El estadio est\u00e1 muy bien ubicado, est\u00e1 limpio, seguro, y las luces que se encienden cada vez que el Necaxa anota gol, se ven incre\u00edbles

address.streetAddress: Manuel Madrigal 101. Col. Heroes

159313331.name: El Mejor estadio de Mexico, Para el Mejor Equipo de Mexico
159313331.author: a TripAdvisor user
159313331.reviewBody:
Sin lugar a dudas este es uno de los mejores estadios del pais, moderno, bonito, funcional, las instalaciones para los equipos (vestidores, etc.) son de primer nivel. La gente de aguascalientes es muy amable, tranquila y servicial, me atreveria a decir que este es el unico estadio 100% familiar. Aqui no se tolera la violencia, si algun aficionado actua de manera incorrecta TODOS lo señalan y es sacado del inmueble. 

Una lastima que los Hidro Rayos esten atravesando por una mala racha, ojala vuelva a haber fubol de primera division en Aguas calientes, pues su gente se lo merece.

Fuerza Rayos!!

97297901.name: El Estadio sede de los Rayos del Necaxa
97297901.author: a TripAdvisor user
97297901.reviewBody: A unos pasos de la Av. de la Convenci\u00f3n, Oriente se ubica el Estadio Victoria que es la sede del equipo de futbol de los "Rayos" del Necaxa. Es un estadio nuevo, pues lo acaban de reinaugurar despu\u00e9s de la remodelaci\u00f2n de lo que era el Estadio Municipal.\n\nEl Estadio Victoria tiene como atractivo especial unas fuentes danzantes que se activan con cada gol del Necaxa.
